      • readResourceAsStream

        public static Stream<String> readResourceAsStream​(String absolutePath)
        Reads given resource file and returns its content as a stream of lines. If you try to read resource from the module you need to "open" that module to xfunction, otherwise Java will throw NPE.
        Parameters:
        absolutePath - absolute path to the resource in form "xxx/xxx/.../resource"

      • readResourceAsStream

        public static Stream<String> readResourceAsStream​(Class<?> clazz,
                                                  String name)
        Reads given resource file and returns its content as a stream of lines If you try to read resource from the module you need to "open" that module to xfunction, otherwise Java will throw NPE.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class in which package resource is located
        name - resource name

      • readResource

        public static String readResource​(String absolutePath)
        Reads given resource file and returns its content as a string If you try to read resource from the module you need to "open" that module to xfunction, otherwise Java will throw NPE.
        Parameters:
        absolutePath - absolute path to the resource in form "xxx/xxx/.../resource"

      • readResource

        public static String readResource​(Class<?> clazz,
                                  String name)
        Reads given resource file and returns its content as a string If you try to read resource from the module you need to "open" that module to xfunction, otherwise Java will throw NPE.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class in which package resource is located
        name - resource name

                                Object... objs)
        Throws RuntimeException with formatted message

      • quote

        public static String quote​(String s)

        Trims the string and:

        • If string starts or ends with quote - nothing is done
        • Surrounds it with quotes and returns

      • unquote

        public static String unquote​(String s)
        Trims the string and removes quotes from the head and tail. If string has one quote or no quotes nothing is done.

      • printExceptions

        public static void printExceptions​(Throwable ex)
        Prints all exceptions including suppressed ones
